hook.text: You finished the email but your brain is still composing replies while you're trying to do actual deep work.

buildup.text: Sophie Leroy discovered attention residue: when you switch tasks, part of your attention stays stuck on the previous one.

discovery.text: Residue is strongest when the previous task is unfinished or unresolved. The brain keeps processing it in the background.

twist.text: Even a quick glance at email between tasks creates residue. The brain can't context-switch cleanly despite what you feel.

climax.text: Before starting deep work, close all previous tasks completely. Write down pending items. Clear the mental stage.

punchline.text: Close the last task fully before starting the next one.

quiz.question: What is attention residue?
options: Part of your attention staying on a previous task after switching
